comments.body: Don't forget to do the same for ``AggregationCursor<T>``and remove overriding methods of ``Collection`` (like ``find()``) that return ``Cursor<any>`` and ``AggregationCursor<any>``. They are unnecessary now.
You are right, I forgot to update the `AggregationCursor`. I'll try to do it today. Thanks for the reminder!

Can you add an `@deprecated` to the description of count on [line 496](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/27008/files/d2d46bcd46b775c64dcc7bfad8b07e9901fceb12#diff-2b1325c7d29dbe7167881a665318da51R496) so the deprecated status if reflected here?
Done. I've added a @deprecated sign per comment, under the URL to be consistent with insertOne, remove, etc. Thanks.

Thanks, just a nitpick. It would be better if the deprecated where in the same jsdoc comment so the editors show both
Like:
```ts
/** 
 * http://mongodb.github.io/node-mongodb-native/3.1/api/Collection.html#count
 * @deprecated Use countDocuments or estimatedDocumentCount 
 */
 count(callback: MongoCallback<number>): void;
```
Can you also update `CommonOptions ` at line 455 and `GridFSBucketWriteStreamOptions ` at line 1626 to make them extend this interface? Just to avoid duplicating the interfaces

updated the interface 9c3770f940c74b04b66a71156d52f42fbc6e037a
unfortunately the options of  GridFSBucketWriteStreamOptions differ from WriteConcern
